requirement_tested: Implement a 2048 game board with a 4x4 grid layout
user_persona: A casual gamer named Alex who wants to play a quick round of 2048 during a break.
user_goal: To see the 4x4 game grid loaded properly with initial tiles and start playing.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Game Website
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the 2048 game website and expects to see the game board right away.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A 4x4 grid is displayed prominently on a linen background, with two starting tiles (e.g., two '2' tiles) visible in random positions.

requirement_tested: Support tile movement in four directions: up, down, left, and right
user_persona: A frequent player named Taylor who prefers using keyboard shortcuts for faster gameplay.
user_goal: To move all tiles in the desired direction using arrow keys.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Tile Movement
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sees the initial tiles and decides to move them to the right by pressing the Right Arrow key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All tiles shift towards the right edge of the grid, stopping either at the edge or before colliding with another tile.

requirement_tested: Enable merging of identical adjacent tiles during movement
user_persona: Jordan, an experienced player aiming to build higher-value tiles efficiently.
user_goal: To merge two adjacent tiles of the same value into one with their combined value.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Up Merge Scenario
narrative_steps.description: Jordan arranges the board so that two '4' tiles are side-by-side horizontally and prepares to move right.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The two '4' tiles merge into a single '8' tile, and the score increases by 8.

requirement_tested: Track and display the current game score
user_persona: Morgan, a competitive player aiming to beat their personal best score.
user_goal: To monitor the current score and compare it with their best score.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Initial Score Display
narrative_steps.description: Morgan looks at the top of the game board to verify the current and best scores are shown.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the score panel above the grid.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two clearly labeled sections are visible: 'Score: 0' and 'Best: [previous best]', both styled in maroon text against the linen background.

narrative_steps.title: Updating After Merge
narrative_steps.description: Morgan makes a move that causes two tiles to merge, increasing the score.
narrative_steps.action: Merge two tiles by moving them together.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'Score' value updates instantly to reflect the points gained from the merge.

requirement_tested: Detect and handle game over state when no moves are available
user_persona: Casey, a focused player who has been playing for a while and just made a move that might end the game.
user_goal: To be notified when there are no more valid moves and the game ends.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Game Over Condition
narrative_steps.description: After a series of moves, Casey fills the entire grid with tiles such that no adjacent tiles are identical and no moves remain.
narrative_steps.action: Make a final move that leaves no possible next moves.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The screen slightly dims, and a modal pops up displaying 'Game Over!' in large maroon font, with 'Revive' and 'New Game' buttons.

requirement_tested: Allow users to start a new game at any time
user_persona: Riley, a curious player experimenting with different strategies.
user_goal: To reset the game and begin a fresh session mid-play.

narrative_steps.title: Locating New Game Button
narrative_steps.description: While playing, Riley notices the 'New Game' button near the top-right corner and decides to restart.
narrative_steps.action: Click the circular 'New Game' button with the '+' icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game board resets to its initial state with two new random tiles, and the score returns to zero.

requirement_tested: Implement win condition detection when a tile reaches 2048
user_persona: Sam, a determined player close to winning the classic 2048 challenge.
user_goal: To be acknowledged once they successfully create a 2048 tile.

narrative_steps.title: Creating the 2048 Tile
narrative_steps.description: Sam carefully maneuvers tiles until finally merging two '1024' tiles into a '2048' tile.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A celebratory modal appears with 'You Win!' in bold maroon text, accompanied by confetti animation effects, while the game remains playable.

requirement_tested: Provide a revive option after game over to continue playing
user_persona: Jamie, deeply engaged in a long-running game that ended unexpectedly.
user_goal: To resume the game from the point of loss instead of starting over.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing to Revive
narrative_steps.description: After seeing the Game Over modal, Jamie chooses to continue rather than restart completely.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Revive' button in the Game Over modal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The modal disappears, and the game board reactivates with the previous grid state restored, ready for the next move.

requirement_tested: Design the game interface with a linen background color
user_persona: Taylor, a design-conscious user appreciating clean aesthetics.
user_goal: To enjoy a visually soothing interface with consistent background styling.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Taylor loads the game and takes note of the overall visual theme, especially the background.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire page background is rendered in a soft linen tone (#FAF0E6), providing a warm and inviting backdrop for the game.

requirement_tested: Style all game components using maroon as the primary color
user_persona: Jordan, a detail-oriented player who pays attention to UI consistency.
user_goal: To observe uniform usage of maroon across all interactive and structural elements.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Visual Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scans the interface looking for cohesive use of the chosen accent color.
narrative_steps.action: Look at various UI elements including buttons, grid borders, and score text.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All relevant elements—buttons, grid lines, score numbers, and modal headers—are styled consistently with maroon (#800000).

requirement_tested: Ensure smooth tile animations during movement and merging
user_persona: Morgan, someone who enjoys polished gaming experiences.
user_goal: To experience seamless and pleasant motion feedback when manipulating tiles.

narrative_steps.title: Animating Tile Movements
narrative_steps.description: Morgan slides tiles across the board and watches how they transition between positions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tiles glide smoothly into place using CSS transitions (~150ms), with subtle fade-in effects upon creation and scaling during merges.

requirement_tested: Display numeric values clearly on each tile
user_persona: Casey, a practical player needing immediate recognition of tile values.
user_goal: To quickly identify the numeric value of each tile at a glance.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Tile Values
narrative_steps.description: Casey focuses on individual tiles to confirm their numeric representation is readable.
narrative_steps.action: Observe several tiles with varying values.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each tile displays a bold, centered number matching its value, sized appropriately for clarity and high contrast against the tile background.

requirement_tested: Maintain game state persistence during gameplay
user_persona: Riley, often interrupted during play sessions and wants to pick up where they left off.
user_goal: To retain the current game state even after accidentally refreshing the page.

narrative_steps.title: Reloading Mid-Game
narrative_steps.description: In the middle of a promising game, Riley refreshes the browser unintentionally.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game resumes exactly from the last known state, preserving the grid configuration and score due to local storage caching.

requirement_tested: Include responsive design for different screen sizes
user_persona: Sam, primarily plays on a mobile device but occasionally switches to desktop.
user_goal: To have a consistent and usable experience regardless of screen size.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Mobile Layout
narrative_steps.description: Sam accesses the game on their smartphone and checks if everything fits well and remains functional.
narrative_steps.action: Open the game on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts gracefully to the smaller viewport, maintaining readability and usability with appropriately scaled grid and controls.

requirement_tested: Add keyboard support for arrow key navigation
user_persona: Alex, a power user comfortable navigating entirely through keyboard input.
user_goal: To fully control the game without touching the mouse.

narrative_steps.title: Using Keyboard Controls
narrative_steps.description: Alex focuses on the game board and uses only arrow keys to make moves.
narrative_steps.action: Press ArrowUp, ArrowDown, ArrowLeft, and ArrowRight keys.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each key press initiates the corresponding tile movement action, equivalent to swiping on a touchscreen, enabling full keyboard-based gameplay.
